sentence.Network_en: She found that the pursuer was close at her heels.
sentence.Network_cn: 她发现追赶者紧紧地跟在她后面.

sentence.Network_en: He found the pursuer close at his heels.
sentence.Network_cn: 他发现跟踪者紧跟在他后面.

sentence.Network_en: A glance behind confirmed his fears. His pursuer was gaining ground on him rapidly.
sentence.Network_cn: 往后看使他越发害怕, 追他的人很快就要赶上来了.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 中女性大多扮演‘追逐者’（“Pursuer”）的角色，而男性大多扮演‘逃避者’（“Distancer”）的角色。
pursue 追赶pursuer 追随者pursuit plane 驱逐机

entry.def: Your pursuers are the people who are chasing or searching for you.

example.ex: They had shaken off their pursuers.

means.word_mean: 1. a person who is pursuing and trying to overtake or capture;

sentences.sentence: "always before he had been able to outwit his pursuers"

means.word_mean: 2. a person who pursues some plan or goal;

auth_sentence.content: With his pursuer close behind...Hubert...ran for the doorway.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: With his pursuer close behind...Hubert...ran for the doorway.

auth_sentence.content: A pursuer might in petitory action conclude for...a grossly extravagant sum.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: A pursuer might in petitory action conclude for...a grossly extravagant sum.

auth_sentence.content: He always seemed to me to be a good pursuer, Eljiofor says.

sentences.en: He found the pursuer close at his heels.
sentences.cn: 他发现跟踪者紧跟在他后面。

sentences.en: A glance behind confirmed his fears. His pursuer was gaining ground on him rapidly.
sentences.cn: 往后看使他越发害怕,追他的人很快就要赶上来了。

sentences.en: He twisted and turned in a desperate attempt to shake off his pursuer.
sentences.cn: 他左拐右转拼命想甩掉追他的人。
